My friend was 10 feet in front of me picking me up in his jeep when 10 tons of pain rained down upon him from a fighter plane above and blew his carcass about a mile away right off a cliff in front of me.

Then I got home and played Battlefield 2042.

150826822.review:
Grug see "Battlefield 2042" as storm that not only broke the spear but also scared away the spirit of the hunt. It not just stop "Battlefield V" from growing, it also forget what make Battlefield the great tribe gathering. "Battlefield 1" was like great leader, show way with strong story, thick atmosphere, drums of war that make blood hot. But "2042", it lose map, lose drum, sound just echo, not song.

Specialists in "2042", they no fit, like stones in boot, uncomfortable, not part of tribe dance. They have no stories that bind them to us, no songs for them in the wind. They no fit in with the clan, with the great Battlefield fire that bring us together for many moons.

Gameplay, it twist and turn, like river that lost way to sea. It should be like great hunt, where every warrior has place, has role. "2042" throw away old tools, give shiny new ones, but not sharp, not right for hunt. Progression, like climb without peak, like hunt without catch, no reward, no feast at end.

And the beasts, the vehicles, they once were mighty, fight with warriors on ground, in sky. Now, they just annoy, like buzz in ear, like thorn in foot. They no bring warriors together, no make strong pack. They should be like mammoth, strong with herd, weak alone. But "2042" mammoth lost, lonely, angry.

Maps, they once were grounds for legends, for tales of glory. Now, they just empty, like caves without paintings, without stories. "Battlefield 1" had lands of wonder, of fear, of excitement. "2042" maps, they no hold that spirit, no carry that weight.

Grug see all this, and Grug heart heavy. "Battlefield 2042" could have been great hunt, could have been new legend. But it forget ancestors, forget what make Battlefield more than noise, more than just fight. It lose way. Grug hope one day, they find way back, make game that honor old, bring new fire, true fire. Until then, Grug keep memory of "Battlefield 1", of true hunt, and wait for day when we gather round fire again, tell stories of great battles, with drums that make us feel alive. Grug wait, but Grug also remember.

150037206.review: Looking for a game that black screens every 2.5 minutes? Well let me tell you about this gem and how it won't leave you disappointed. Ever find yourself wishing you could take a break from a game but not being able to step away because you are having such a blast with your friends. Well look no further, with BF2042's patented technology it just magically knows when you need a break and will force you to stop playing and take that much needed black screen break. Need a snack, a drink or even a much needed pee break? Well this game has you covered with those frequent black screen breaks. What's that you say? You need an excuse to get off because your teammates are trash! Well no worries friend, Black screen has you covered. No more need for lying to your friends just because you want to go to bed. With black screen technology you can simply tell them you are to frustrated to play any longer. Black Screen, bringing the future of gaming technology to gamer's everywhere!

The implementation of AI bots and crossplay, and absence of cheaters makes this pretty much the only Battlefield to bother with these days. It was optimized for my PC with very few bugs/issues.

The negatives are the lack of multiple features like server browsing, joining the opposite team and the biggest being that there is no campaign, which is nothing but laziness for a game that cost $60.

Overall, I enjoyed my time with it, but I would only recommend it when it's on sale.

152466044.review:
TL;DR: Better than release, get it on sale. 

I pre-ordered gold edition like a donut on xbox before i had my pc, game was terrible.  Since then, it has come a long way and although not the game that was promised, its improved a lot and once again has the battlefield feeling.

pros: The map reworks are great and have the maps feeling like a true battlefield instead of the clean and polished maps they had on release. The destructible assets are a nice feature.
Portal (BF Era) weapons are balanced nice and the skins/charms is a nice touch. 
specialists are now into classes with gadgets restricted to classes.  
Game is less buggy and more smooth to play.
full servers!!!

cons: Portal (the love letter to fans) has been abandoned, no new maps etc. 
Minimal map destruction.
Specialists are still there.
The game still feels like a large scale TDM in Apex at times.
Vehicles are still annoying AF (skill issue) 


Get this whilst it is on sale :)

151061045.review:
Battlefield 2042 - A Step in the Right Direction, But Room for Growth! 

After sinking countless hours into Battlefield 2042, it's safe to say that DICE has made some commendable improvements since launch. The game's gunplay feels tighter, and the overall experience is more polished compared to the initial release.

However, the one aspect that still requires attention is the player count. Battlefield 2042 thrives on large-scale battles, but finding a full lobby can be hit or miss, especially in certain regions. It's a bit disheartening to see such expansive maps with not enough soldiers to fill them, affecting the overall balance and enjoyment of the game.

Another head-scratcher is the map rotation decision. Some maps seem to appear more frequently than others, leading to a somewhat repetitive experience or the maps get removed from DICE. Weirdly often the most fun ones. 

In conclusion, Battlefield 2042 has certainly taken a step in the right direction, and the improvements are commendable. 
Here's hoping for continued updates and refinements to make this futuristic battlefield the best it can be!

151863218.review:
I just got it recently and despite the negativity that surrounded the game when it first came out, I can say that the game is fun and I haven't encountered any bugs so far. This is my first battlefield game that I've played since Bad Company 2 and Battlefield 3, and this game doesn't live up to them. The game play is fun and the shooting is satisfying, but that's about it. The maps are boring. They're too open, spaced out, and there's no real flow to them. The destructible environments might as well not exist. The classes are also boring. 

The game play feels watered down because it doesn't feel dynamic and it just comes down to shooting. Each class has a certain special ability like all the other battlefield games, but since the game play is so fast paced and the maps are so open, they don't feel unique or have any real utility. Medics can be useful sometimes, but if you have decent squad mates, then they can revive you anyway regardless of their class. Also since any class can use any type of weapon, it makes the class type even more moot. Sure each class specializes in a certain weapon type and they gain certain benefits from it, but it's really not that big of a hindrance to use a different weapon.

I can't really explain it, but between the poor map design, the game's fast paced focus (faster than what a good Battlefield game feels like), and the fading of classes, it just feels like a watered down shooter that looks like a Battlefield game, but lost touch with what a Battlefield game is suppose to be. All I want is more Bad Company.

Actually, all I want is a 2142 remake.

Also, fuck you EA for locking a third of your content behind the elite edition.

Is it worth $10.00? For some mindless fun, sure. It beats getting an aneurysm from sweating in Warzone. Is it ever worth handing over your money to EA? Absolutely the fuck not.

151223585.review: At the time of writing this text, B2042 is running fine. Unfortunately, the game is quite boring: there are few modes, the maps are not well-designed. My subjective opinion is that only the “capture the flag” mode is balanced enough to make the team confrontation exciting. But the maps lack destructibility, and it would be better to remove the possibility of hiding in textures and shooting through invisible gaps in objects. Battlefield 2042 can be given a chance, but at the moment it is worth buying only at a discount, so as not to be disappointed.

150536634.review: Smaller the gun the more damage it does. Explosive are useless and have been nerfed to high hell. 4+ rockets to kill any vehicle that all have multiple systems to stop or shoot down rockets and have auto repair systems so your need a full squad of rockets to kill anything. Vehicles OP. Lets go back to good old battlefield these new ones suck. Hit registration terrible

153444017.review: I avoided this game for a long time due to the bad reviews.  A buddy told me they they have been working on the game non stop and that it's actually good now. I got in on sale for the fall sale and am really enjoying the game. I've seen 0 game breaking bugs, the combat is awesome, the sounds are just as good as any battlefield game out there. The effects are awesome too. Definitely get this game and stop listening to the hate. There are plenty of people playing. Games are always full but we need more!

153443143.review:
(Only jumped in a quarter into season 6)
Honestly, this ain't that bad of a game, I've been having TONS  of fun with this! :D 
Large scale battles are what draw me to Battlefield and this one delivers as always, and when I don't feel like thinking too much, Redacted shows up as a alternative within the same game!

Could it be better? ABSOLUTELY! 
This game NEEDS a campaign, make it fun, different, make me FEEL for the characters/specialists and make it Co-op!!! 
Like where did all the destructible environments go?
Holy hell they need more maps, large-scale battles are SO limited for choice! 

Personally I like the specialist system, HOWEVER, I'm not attached to any of them (see line about needing a campaign), and I've love to see a tweak where the specialists more cosmetic (make it so we can swap abilities/tools/etc)

(Also the people complaining about the Specialists being available on both side, y'all completely missed the point of a 'no-pat' and it shows, lol)
(and those complaining about performance at this point, I haven't seen this nearly to the point y'all are, sure a few crashes here and there but that's on par with any game nowadays)
